key_points: The outage was caused by a maintenance error in the system managing global network capacity.
The Facebook backbone network, connecting all computing facilities globally, was unintentionally taken down.
This disconnection caused a complete loss of server connectivity between data centers and the internet.
A bug in the audit tool failed to prevent the mistaken command, leading to the outage.
DNS servers became unreachable due to BGP advertisements being disabled, as they couldn't connect to the data centers.
Engineers faced difficulties diagnosing and resolving the issue due to loss of normal and out-of-band network access.
On-site engineers were needed to restart systems, a process delayed by high security measures at data centers.
The company conducted "storm" drills to prepare for such events, aiding in the quick recovery.
A review process is underway to improve system resilience and prevent similar outages.
The incident highlighted a trade-off between hardened security and the speed of recovery from internal errors.
